message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.HC, cs.RO 

This paper deals with computer vision problems such as person segmentation and identification in videos, which are typically covered under the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The use of wearable cameras and the need to organize heterogeneous collections of videos suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. The paper proposes a joint approach to segmentation and identification, which involves machine learning techniques such as deep neural networks, suggesting that the paper may also be relevant to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper also discusses the challenges of dealing with multiple cameras and people in public spaces, which suggests that the paper may be relevant to the human-computer interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a method for identifying the camera wearer in third-person videos, which suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the robotics (cs.RO) sub-category.
